Posts.Content: Sweetpea4071 wrote: In March, I found a lump in my right breast under my armpit, close to the lymph nodes.  It was after my period and I waited a week to call the doctor to see if it would go away.  I was very scared when I found it, because it felt big and I had never felt it there before.  When I went to the doctor he had no problem finding the lump.  The doctor ordered an ultrasound, saying I was too young for a mammogram, even though my mom had a lumpectomy at 21 to remove a benign lipoma (the same age I was when I found my lump--I am now 22).  The ultrasound found nothing.  My follow-up exam I had with another doctor because I did not like the first doctor I saw.  Again he also found the lump without me having to tell him where it was or show him.  Because of my mom's history, he decided that I should have a mammogram done.  So I went to have that done and it showed nothing also.  I'm not sure if its because I am younger and so my breast tissue is more dense, but I could not believe that neither the ultrasound nor the mammogram could detect this lump, yet both doctors could easily find it and the second doctor said he could even see a change in the contour of my right breast where the lump is compared to my other breast.  He had given me a list of breast surgeons to have the lump removed, but at my last follow-up visit he told me the lump had not grown so he didn't think it was necessary for me to go to the breast surgeon unless it got bigger or unless it worried me.  I have now had the lump for 6 months and about last month I have noticed, on occasion, some dull pain where the lump is.  It is tolerable and doesn't last very long, maybe a day at most, but it does seem to be occurring more frequently over the last couple of weeks.  Why wouldn't the lump show up on the two tests and should I make an appointment to see the breast surgeon?
